description: Numbers whose set of base 7 digits is {0,1}.
comments: Sums of distinct powers of 7.a(n) modulo 2 is the Prouhet-Thue-Morse sequence A010060. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 17 2011Note that this sequence has offset 1, in contrast to A000695 and all others among A033043 - A033052. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 01 2016
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1024
formula: a(n)=Sum{d(i)*7^i: i=0, 1, ..., m}, where Sum{d(i)*2^i: i=0, 1, ..., m} is the base 2 representation of n.a(n) = A097253(n)/6.a(2n) = 7*a(n), a(2n+1) = a(2n)+1.a(n+1)=Sum_k>=0 {A030308(n,k)*7^k}. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 17 2011

author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: _Karol Bacik_ has pointed out that the first three formulas do not match the sequence. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 20 2012
